player.aiHelper

Class Minimax

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.aiHelper.Minimax
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlphaBeta, Expectiminimax

    public class Minimax
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple minimax algorithm with no optimisations.

      • Minimax

        public Minimax(AINode root,

        maxColour -

    • Method Detail

      • successors

        final java.util.List<AINode> successors(AINode initial,
                                        java.util.Set<scotlandyard.Move> options)
        Given a node/gamestate and the possible moves the current player can make, it simulates the moves to copies of the given node and returns a set of possible successor game states. It also stores a reference to the first set of successors.
        Parameters:
        initial - Inital gamestate
        options - Possible moves
        Returns:
        A set of possible gamestates

      • decision

        scotlandyard.Move decision(AINode initialState)
        Run the algorithm once, creating a tree for the current MAX_DEPTH
        Parameters:
        initialState - The initial state
        Returns:
        A best move

      • executeMinimax

        public static final scotlandyard.Move executeMinimax(AINode root,
                                                     scotlandyard.Colour maxColour,
                                                     Minimax.AIType type)
        Static method used to start the execution of the algorithm. It starts the algorithm on a separate thread while the current thread sleeps for a specified time. Once the time limit has been reached, it sends a stop signal to the Minimax thread, which causes it to immediately return. The method returns the move calculated by the last fully explored game tree.
        Parameters:
        root - Initial state of game
        maxColour - Colour of MAX
        type - Type of AI
        Returns:
        the move calculated by the last fully explored game tree
